publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3852 Ms Rosemary Byrne: Protecting Jobs and Services in the Borders—That the Parliament condemns the Westminster Government’s policy decision to migrate the benefit process of the Work and Pensions Office in Galashiels to the central belt; acknowledges that this action will cause job losses affecting workers and their families, as well as detrimentally affect services for the most vulnerable members of our society, and calls on the Scottish Executive to put pressure on its colleagues in Westminster to reverse this decision and protect jobs and services in the Scottish Borders.

S2M-3852 Ms Rosemary Byrne: Protecting Jobs and Services in the Borders—That the Parliament condemns the Westminster Government’s policy decision to migrate the benefit process of the Work and Pensions Office in Galashiels to the central belt; acknowledges that this action will cause job losses affecting workers and their families, as well as detrimentally affect services for the most vulnerable members of our society, and calls on the Scottish Executive to put pressure on its colleagues in Westminster to reverse this decision and protect jobs and services in the Scottish Borders.
S2M-3852 Protecting Jobs and Services in the Borders (lodged on 19 January 2006) Christine Grahame*, Frances Curran*, Robin Harper*, Phil Gallie*, Carolyn Leckie*
S2M-3852 Protecting Jobs and Services in the Borders (lodged on 19 January 2006) Chris Ballance*
S2M-3852 Protecting Jobs and Services in the Borders (lodged on 19 January 2006) Rosie Kane*
